JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Wolly & Co ApS is applying on behalf of their Swedish Filial, Sweden Home Outfitters.

Are you ready to take your accounting skills to the next level? Would you like to be part of a company that values your ambitions? Are you ready to lead and develop our financial operations in close collaboration with our CFO?

Then become an integral part of an agile, growing company where you'll join a small but strong finance team in an exciting international environment.

This position is based in Sweden.

Wolly & Co. is a Danish design and trading company specializing in designing, developing, and selling home textiles, decor, and clothing. We collaborate with some of the largest retail chains in Europe, and our passion lies in finding inspiration worldwide for new, appealing lifestyle products.

Here, you'll join 70 colleagues – 30 in Denmark and 40 in Asia.

Take your skills to new heights

As a Group Financial Controller, you'll act as a sparring partner for our CFO, working closely with colleagues in the finance team and other stakeholders within the company. You’ll take on a broad role with responsibilities including:

  • Responsible for the Swedish Filial, including supporting companies in Denmark, Germany, the Netherlands, India, Hong Kong, China, and Pakistan.

  • Project optimization and further development of Microsoft Business Central and Power BI.

  • Responsible for developing our Supply Chain System (WRP).

  • Monthly group reporting.

  • Economic follow-up and KPI tracking.

  • Development and maintenance of Excel/Business Intelligence reports for the sales department.

  • Participation in budgeting and forecasting.

  • Responsible for establishing operations in Sweden, including setting up an office in Malmö/Skåne.

We provide you with the best framework for professional development and the opportunity to fulfill your career ambitions with us. This is achieved in a relaxed and dynamic environment filled with challenges but also a strong focus on work-life balance.

There are several paths to this role

We are looking for the following:

  • A masters degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related fields (Cand.Merc., Cand.Oecon., MBA, or similar).

  • At least 3 years of relevant experience in FP&A or operations finance.

  • Experience with Microsoft Business Central/Dynamics NAV (Navision) is a requirement.

  • Familiarity with Power BI or similar business intelligence tools is mandatory.

  • Fluency in one of the Nordic languages and English, written and spoken, at a professional level.

  • Experience in developing supply chain systems.

  • Experience in coding (Kali Linux & VBA)
Work Arrangement

This role is based in Sweden and offers fully remote or hybrid work options.

Travel is expected to be: 10-15%.
